snippet: A California case could establish or reject a right to same-sex marriage, while a New York case contests a law denying federal benefits to couples married in those states that allow it.
abstract: Supreme Court announces that it will enter national debate over same-sex marriage, agreeing to hear a pair of cases challenging state and federal laws that define marriage to include only unions of a man and a woman;  move comes against the backdrop of rapid shift in public attitudes about same-sex marriage, with polls indicating that majority of Americans support allowing such unions.
lead_paragraph: A California case could establish or reject a right to same-sex marriage, while a New York case contests a law denying federal benefits to couples married in those states that allow it.
